ScratchJr Resource Platform

I am the project manager of a small team at DevTech Research Group working to design and build a Wordpress site for educators and parents to share resources related to ScratchJr. View the beta site live at scratchjrconnect.tufts.edu/.

Mid-fidelity prototype of the home page (Click for full view)

  • time range: September 2019-present
  • client: DevTech Research Group
  • tools: Wordpress Plugins and Themes, Pen & Paper, Figma, Git, HTML/CSS, Javascript, PHP
  • team members: Emil Polackiewicz, Matthew Fiedler (past members: Devon Minor, Kaavya Chaparala, Albert Tseng, Wei-ren Murray, Tom Ribeiro, Aim Unahalekhaka)

Our goal is to create a functional website that allows users to submit resources pertaining to ScratchJr, which is a tablet-based application for children ages 4-7 years old to learn to program while exercising their creativity and making fun character animations.

Our work so far has consisted of two broad tasks: conceptualizing a website structure that would make sense to users, and assessing what capabilities Wordpress has to realize this website structure. Since we are picking up on previous research that past students at DevTech have provided us, we have started by building a medium-fidelity prototype in Figma and testing it with teachers who use ScratchJr and would therefore want to use this website.

Now, we are using our Figma prototype and our user feedback to begin implementing site features in Wordpress using plugins such as Formidable Forms and Custom Post Types UI. Since we are a small team, it has been a huge challenge to juggle these roles that would normally be delegated to more people. At the same time, it has been an intense yet rewarding experience to learn the ins and outs of the experience design & research process.
